content:
Diagnosis
	1. Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2023

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	None

	Radiotherapy
	1. March 2023 - Palliative radiotherapy to T12 metastasis
	2. August 2023 - Palliative radiotherapy to right hip

	Systemic therapy
	1. January-June 2023 - ADT and Docetaxel chemotherapy
	2. July-October 2023 - Enzalutamide
	3. November 2023-present - Cabazitaxel

	Clinical studies
	None suitable

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with rising PSA and new bone metastases

	Current issues
	1. Worsening bone pain
	2. Progressive fatigue
	3. Weight loss

	Summary of consultation

Unfortunately [redacted name]'s disease has continued to progress despite third-line treatment with cabazitaxel. His PSA has risen from 450 to 789 over the past 6 weeks. Recent bone scan shows multiple new metastases in the thoracic and lumbar spine. His performance status has declined to ECOG 2-3, now spending most of the day resting due to fatigue and pain.

On examination today, he is cachectic with tender points in thoracic spine. Blood pressure 142/85, pulse 92. No focal neurological deficits identified.

We have discussed the situation in detail. Given his declining performance status and limited benefit from current treatment, we have agreed to discontinue cabazitaxel. Recent molecular testing shows AR amplification, making further androgen-receptor targeted therapy unlikely to be beneficial.

	Further investigations
	1. Urgent MRI spine to exclude cord compression
	2. Bone profile and LFTs

	Medication changes
	1. Increased MST to 60mg BD
	2. Added pregabalin 75mg BD for neuropathic pain

	Follow up
	1. Urgent palliative care review arranged for tomorrow
	2. Oncology review in 1 week with scan results

	Required GP actions
	1. Please monitor renal function
	2. Consider community support referral

primary_cancer.metastases: multiple bone metastases in thoracic and lumbar spine

cancer_timeline.value: PSA risen from 450 to 789 over 6 weeks
Bone scan shows multiple new metastases in thoracic and lumbar spine
Discontinued Cabazitaxel due to disease progression and declining performance status

patient_facts.value: ECOG PS 2-3, spending most of day resting
Tender points in thoracic spine, BP 142/85, pulse 92, no focal neurological deficits

status_updates.value: Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer with progressive disease despite three lines of therapy. Now showing clinical deterioration with rising PSA and new bone metastases
Disease progression on cabazitaxel with rising PSA and new bone metastases
Discontinuing cabazitaxel due to disease progression and poor performance status
Declining performance status to ECOG 2-3 with increasing fatigue and pain
Urgent MRI spine to exclude cord compression, bone profile and LFTs
Urgent palliative care review tomorrow, oncology review in 1 week with scan results
